sen.e: Two pillars of the Tokimune administration consisted of the Tokuso vassals headed by Yoritsuna on the one hand, and Yasumori who represented the Adachi clan, who were both maternal relatives to the shogun and "tozama gokenin" (nonhereditary retainers of the bakufu), on the other.

sen.e: The retainers who fell from power at the Shimotsuki Incident were gradually brought back.
The retainers who fell from power at the Shimotsuki Incident were gradually brought back.

sen.j: 安達一族も泰盛の弟安達顕盛の孫である安達時顕が安達家の家督を継承している。
sen.e: Tokiaki ADACHI who was the grandson of Akimori ADACHI, Yasumori's younger brother, became the heir of the Adachi clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: So did the Adachi clan, and Tokiaki ADACHI, who was the grandson of Akimori ADACHI, Yasumori's younger brother, succeeded to the family headship.
sen.cmt: "So did the Adachi clan"を挿入しました。「家督を継承した」→「跡継ぎになる」とは少し違うので修正しました。
sen.e: So did the Adachi clan, and Tokiaki ADACHI, who was the grandson of Akimori ADACHI, Yasumori's younger brother, succeeded to the family headship.

sen.j: 頼綱滅亡の翌年には騒動の罹災者の復権が進んだ。
sen.e: A year after Yoritsuna's death the victims of the Shimotsuki Incident started to be reinstated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A year after Yoritsuna's death the victims of the Shimotsuki Incident started to be reinstated.
A year after Yoritsuna's death the victims of the Shimotsuki Incident started to be reinstated.

sen.j: 時顕が文保元年（1317年）年に霜月騒動で討たれた父宗顕の33回忌供養を行った際の記録には、その頃まで泰盛の供養がタブーであった事が記されている。
sen.e: The account of the 33rd memorial service for Yasumori who perished in the Shimotsuki Incident held in 1317 by his son Tokiaki mentions that it was a taboo to hold a memorial service for Yasumori till then.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The account of the 33rd memorial service for Yasumori, who perished in the Shimotsuki Incident, held in 1317 by his son Tokiaki mentions that it had been a taboo to hold a memorial service for Yasumori till then.
sen.cmt: that以降の時制を修正しました。
sen.e: The account of the 33rd memorial service for Yasumori, who perished in the Shimotsuki Incident, held in 1317 by his son Tokiaki mentions that it had been a taboo to hold a memorial service for Yasumori till then.

sen.j: 『一遍聖絵』には「城の禅門の亡ける日は、聖（一遍）、因幡国におはしけるが、空を見たまいて、鎌倉におほきなる人の損ずるとおぼゆるぞとのたまひけり」と見える。
sen.e: "The Ippen-hijiri-e" (Illustrated Record of the Holy Man Ippen) mentions that 'on the day of Yasumori's death the Holy Man (Ippen) who was in Inba Province looked up to the sky and said, 'A great man perished.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「城の禅門」はおそらく陸奥守をさすと思われますが、確証はないので、Yasumoriとしました。
sen.e: "Ippen-hijiri-e" (Illustrated Record of the Holy Man Ippen) says, 'on the day of Yasumori's death the Holy Man (Ippen) who was in Inba Province looked up to the sky and said, "A great man perished in Kamakura."'
sen.cmt: 『一遍聖絵』→タイトルのローマ字表記に"the"は不要なので削除しました。原文「」内は直接話法なので、"that"は不要だと思います。「鎌倉に」の訳語を挿入しました。
sen.e: "Ippen-hijiri-e" (Illustrated Record of the Holy Man Ippen) says, 'on the day of Yasumori's death the Holy Man (Ippen) who was in Inba Province looked up to the sky and said, "A great man perished in Kamakura."'

sen.j: 「おおきなる人」というその人格を伝えている。
sen.e: The word, 'a great man' speaks for the character of Yasumori.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The word, 'a great man' speaks for the character of Yasumori.
The word, 'a great man' speaks for the character of Yasumori.

sen.j: 仙台城内の青葉山 (仙台市)に霜月騒動の翌々年の2月に建てられた高さ2m近い巨大な板碑がある。
sen.e: In Mt. Aoba in the Sendai Castle (in Sendai City) there is a huge monumental stone tablet in almost two-meter height which was built in March 1287, two years after the Shimotuski Incident.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In Aobayama in Sendai-jo Castle (in Sendai City) there is a huge monumental stone tablet in almost two-meter height, which was built in March 1287, two years after the Shimotuski Incident.
sen.cmt: 「青葉山」は仙台の丘陵地帯の地名で特定の山ではなく、「仙台城の中にある山」というのも変なので、地名として"Aobayama"の方が良いと思います。"Sendai Castle"→"Sendai-jo Castle"と修正しました。（用語統一リスト）
sen.e: In Aobayama in Sendai-jo Castle (in Sendai City) there is a huge monumental stone tablet in almost two-meter height, which was built in March 1287, two years after the Shimotuski Incident.

sen.j: 過ぎし年の11月下旬、煙とともにあのおだやかな姿を消し、黄泉の国に赴いた陸奥守入道の菩提を弔う趣旨の願文が彫り込まれている。
sen.e: The following prayer is engraved on the stone tablet to the effect that we pray to Buddha for the happiness of the Priest and Governor of Mutsu Province whose calm presence vanished in smoke in December of two years ago to descend into the land of the dead.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The prayers are engraved on it, for the happiness of the soul of the Priest and Governor of Mutsu Province whose calm presence vanished in smoke in past December to descend into the land of the dead.
sen.cmt: 書き出しを簡潔にしました。「過ぎし年」は、霜月騒動のあった2年前、と断定して訳すより、原文通り「過去の」と訳した方が良いと思います。
sen.e: The prayers are engraved on it, for the happiness of the soul of the Priest and Governor of Mutsu Province whose calm presence vanished in smoke in past December to descend into the land of the dead.

sen.j: 陸奥守であった泰盛のための板碑であろうと見られている。
sen.e: This appears to have been made for Yasumori who was Governor of Mutsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This appears to have been made for Yasumori who was Governor of Mutsu.
This appears to have been made for Yasumori who was Governor of Mutsu.

sen.j: 『蒙古襲来絵詞』には、肥後国の御家人竹崎季長が甘縄邸で恩賞奉行であった泰盛に直訴する様子が描かれている。
sen.e: "The Moko Shurai Ekotoba" (Illustrate Account of the Mongol Invasion) depicts how Suenaga TAKEZAKI, retainer of Higo Province, directly appealed to Yasumori who was the Chief of the Rewards Office in his residence in Amanawa.

"Moko Shurai Ekotoba" (Illustrated Account of the Mongol Invasion) depicts how Suenaga TAKEZAKI, retainer of Higo Province, directly appealed to Yasumori who was the Chief of the Rewards Office in his residence in Amanawa.
sen.cmt: 『蒙古襲来絵詞』→タイトルのローマ字表記に"the"は不要なので削除しました。
sen.e: "Moko Shurai Ekotoba" (Illustrated Account of the Mongol Invasion) depicts how Suenaga TAKEZAKI, retainer of Higo Province, directly appealed to Yasumori who was the Chief of the Rewards Office in his residence in Amanawa.

sen.j: 絵詞は奥付の日付が泰盛を討った平頼綱が滅ぼされて泰盛派が復活した永仁元年である。
sen.e: The colophon of the text is dated 1293 when Yasumori's fraction was reinstated after TAIRA no Yoritsuna, who assassinated Yasumori, was defeated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The colophon of the text is dated 1293 when Yasumori's faction was reinstated after TAIRA no Yoritsuna, who had assassinated Yasumori, was defeated.
sen.cmt: "fraction"→"faction"に修正しました。時制を修正しました。
sen.e: The colophon of the text is dated 1293 when Yasumori's faction was reinstated after TAIRA no Yoritsuna, who had assassinated Yasumori, was defeated.

sen.j: 恩を受けながら霜月騒動で泰盛方として戦う事のなかった季長。
sen.e: Suenaga did not fight for Yasumori's cause at the Shimotsuki Incident although he was indebted to the latter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Suenaga did not fight for Yasumori at the Shimotsuki Incident although he was indebted to him.
sen.cmt: "cause"は不要だと思います。"the latter"は"him"で良いと思います。
sen.e: Suenaga did not fight for Yasumori at the Shimotsuki Incident although he was indebted to him.

sen.j: 泰盛らへの鎮魂と報謝が込められた挽歌であると考えられている。
sen.e: The depiction of the Illustrated Account of the Mongol Invasion is therefore taken as both his wish for appeasing Yasumori's soul and his expression of gratitude.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The depiction is therefore taken as both his wish for appeasing Yasumori's soul and his expression of gratitude.
sen.cmt: 主語は"the depiction"のみで良いと思います。
sen.e: The depiction is therefore taken as both his wish for appeasing Yasumori's soul and his expression of gratitude.

sen.j: 文化面では後嵯峨院から漢籍を下賜されるなど親交が厚かった。
sen.e: Culturally, Yasumori was friendly with the retired Emperor Gosaga who gave him books of Chinese classics.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Culturally, Yasumori was friendly with the Retired Emperor Gosaga who gave him Chinese classic books.
sen.cmt: "the retired Emperor Gosaga"は頭文字を大文字に修正しました。（用語登録リスト）
sen.e: Culturally, Yasumori was friendly with the Retired Emperor Gosaga who gave him Chinese classic books.

sen.j: 院の崩御の翌年である1273年（文永10年）に高野山奥院に院を追悼する石碑を建立している。
sen.e: In 1273, a year after the retired emperor's death, he built a stone monument in his remembrance in Koyasan Okuno-in Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1273, a year after the retired emperor's death, he built a stone monument in his remembrance in Koyasan Okuno-in Temple.
In 1273, a year after the retired emperor's death, he built a stone monument in his remembrance in Koyasan Okuno-in Temple.

sen.j: 京都的な教養を身につけた実務官僚としての側面もあった。
sen.e: He was also a practical bureaucrat with Kyoto education.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was also a practical bureaucrat with Kyoto education.
He was also a practical bureaucrat with Kyoto education.

sen.j: 公家書道の世尊寺流の秘伝の伝授を受けた。
sen.e: He was initiated into the secret teachings of the Sesonji School of aristocratic calligraphy.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was initiated into the secret teachings of the Sesonji School of aristocratic calligraphy.
He was initiated into the secret teachings of the Sesonji School of aristocratic calligraphy.

sen.j: 18歳の頃に将軍文書の右筆を務めている。
sen.e: He served as amanuensis for the shogun's scriptures at the age of 18.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He served as amanuensis for the shogun at the age of 18.
sen.cmt: "scripture"は「経典」など、権威ある文書、の意味なので、ニュアンスが違うように思います。ここでは「将軍の書記」として、"amanuensis for the shogun"で良いと思います。
sen.e: He served as amanuensis for the shogun at the age of 18.

sen.j: 蹴鞠にも堪能であった。
sen.e: He was a skilful kemari-player.
He was also a skilful player of kemari (literally, "kick-ball," a traditional game popular among nobles).
sen.cmt: 「蹴鞠」→ローマ字表記では分からないと思われるので、説明を入れました。
sen.e: He was also a skilful player of kemari (literally, "kick-ball," a traditional game popular among nobles).

sen.j: 高野山町石道には泰盛の建立した町石が現在も残されている。
sen.e: A stupa-shaped mile stone, erected by Yasumori, still remains in Koyasan-cho Ishi-michi (pilgrimage trails to Mt. Koya).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A stupa-shaped milestone, erected by Yasumori, still remains in Koyasan Choishi-michi (pilgrimage trails to Mt. Koya).
sen.cmt: "mile stone"→"milestone"に修正しました。正しくは「高野山 / 町石 / 道」という区切りです。（http://dic.yahoo.co.jp/dsearch?enc=UTF-8&p=%E4%B8%81&dtype=0&stype=0&dname=0ss&pagenum=1&index=112756200000）
sen.e: A stupa-shaped milestone, erected by Yasumori, still remains in Koyasan Choishi-michi (pilgrimage trails to Mt. Koya).

sen.j: 木版による仏教書である高野本の刊行も行っている。
sen.e: Yasumori also published Takano-bon (Takano Book), a Buddhist text in woodprint.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He also published Buddhist texts in woodprint, which are called Koya-ban (Koya edition).
sen.cmt: 「高野本」→「高野版（こうやばん）」のことだと思います。「高野本」で検索すると、「平家物語の高野本」が多く出てきますが、仏教書ではなく、泰盛が出版したものでもありません。（http://www.nijl.ac.jp/~koen/washyonosamazama/washyo2.htm）
sen.e: He also published Buddhist texts in woodprint, which are called Koya-ban (Koya edition).

sen.j: 信仰面では醍醐寺遍智院の実勝法印から関東において灌頂を受けている。
sen.e: Religiously, he was baptized in Kanto region by the Supreme Priest Jissho of Hechiin, Daigo-ji Temple.
Religiously, he attended the initiation in Kanto region with Supreme Priest Jissho of Hechiin, Daigo-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: 「灌頂」→"baptize"は通常クリスチャンに使う単語だと思います。"Supreme Priest"はタイトルなので"the"はいらないと思います。
sen.e: Religiously, he attended the initiation in the Kanto region with Supreme Priest Jissho of Hechiin, Daigo-ji Temple.

sen.j: 吉田兼好の随筆集『徒然草』にも泰盛が馬の名人であった事を語るエピソードがある。
sen.e: "The Tsurezuregusa" (Essays in Idleness) of Kenko YOSHIDA recounts an episode suggesting that Yasumori was an excellent horseman.
